We are also developing a PQ (Pre-Qualification) lab in our upcoming manufacturing facility at Vadodara (Gujarat) which will ensure our cables are PQ tested against industry standards, ensuring reliability, safety, and long term performance before they reach customers. We believe this reduces the risk of costly failures, builds customer confidence, accelerates approval processes, and provides a competitive edge by demonstrating commitment to quality and compliance.

We believe that our focus on maintaining quality across our products and the continuous technological upgradation of our overhead conductors and cables offerings have enabled us to develop brand recognition, significant brand recall, and customer loyalty in the Power T&D industry.

Our Board of Directors and senior management team bring several years of experience across finance, operations, engineering, and technology. For information about our Directors and senior management, see “Our Management” on page 263. We have also established a track of consistent revenue growth and profitability. From Fiscal 2023 to Fiscal 2025, our revenue from operations (continuing operations) experienced growth at a CAGR of 22.94%. (1) EBITDA is computed as Restated Profit for the year from continuing operations plus total tax expense (continuing operations), finance costs (continuing operations), depreciation and amortisation expense (continuing operations).
(2) EBITDA margin % is computed as EBITDA divided by Total income (continuing operations).
(3) Profit after tax margin % is computed as Restated Profit for the year from continuing operations divided by Total Income (continuing operations).

(4) Return on Equity % is calculated as Restated Profit for the year from continuing operations divided by Average Equity. Average Equity is calculated as average of Total equity at the beginning and at the end of the relevant fiscal.

(5) Return on Capital Employed % is calculated as EBIT divided by Capital employed. EBIT is computed as EBITDA less depreciation and amortisation expense (continuing operations). Capital employed is calculated as Tangible Net worth plus Total Borrowings plus Deferred tax liabilities (net). Tangible Net worth is calculated as total equity less intangible assets (including intangible assets under development) less Right-of-use assets.
(6) Operating Working Capital is calculated as inventories plus trade receivables less trade payables and acceptances.
